data_table.description: UNC Heart Failure Details (Main, Ext1, Ext2)

variable.name: CASEDY
variable.description: Days from enrollment to case date
variable.comment: CASEDY is known for each case that was selected to be sent to UNC for adjudication. It is calculated as the days from enrollment to hospital admission for the case under review (same as ARRIVEDY).

variable.name: UNCHF
variable.description: Definite or possible decompensated heart failure for this case
variable.comment:
UNCHF = 1 if HFDIAG = 1 or 2. This is the standard WHI definition of heart failure using the UNC_x000D_
adjudication.

variable.name: UNCMISSING
variable.description: Participant has a case that is missing documentation or not completed
variable.comment: This flag indicates that the participant has at least one case that either was not sent to UNC for adjudication because it lacked sufficient documentation or WHI has not received the case back from UNC. There are not separate records in this file for the missing cases since no UNC form data exists.

variable.name: ENDWHIDY
variable.description: Days enrollment to end of WHI core study followup
variable.comment: ENDWHIDY should only be used for analyses censoring follow-up at the end of the WHI core study.

variable.name: ENDEXT1DY
variable.description: Days enrollment to end of Ext1 followup
variable.comment: ENDEXT1DY should only be used for analyses censoring follow-up at the end of Ext1.

variable.name: ENDFOLLOWDY
variable.description: Days enrollment to end of followup
variable.comment: ENDFOLLOWDY should be used for analyses utilizing all WHI, Ext1 and Ext2 follow-up.

variable.name: F135DY
variable.description: F135 Days from enrollment to Form 135 completion
variable.comment: 1c. Days from enrollment to Form 135 completion

variable.name: ESTLVEF
variable.comment: 4. Estimated left ventricular ejection fraction (worst; related to current hospitalization)

variable.name: HFDIAG
variable.comment: 5. Assign an overall heart failure diagnosis based on your clinical judgment WHI considers the case to be a heart failure event when HFDIAG = 1 or 2.

variable.name: ADHFTYPE
variable.description: HF type for definite or probable decompensated heart failure
variable.comment: The definition for ADHFTYPE follows that of the ARIC study, and classifies the HF events as decompensated heart failure with preserved ejection fraction, systolic heart failure or recovered.
variable.value: Preserved ejection fraction acute decompensated HF
Recovered ejection fraction acute decompensated HF

variable.name: DECOMP
variable.comment: 5a. Was definite or possible decompensated heart failure present at admission?

variable.name: DECOMPCOD
variable.comment: 6a. Was decompensated heart failure the primary cause of death?

variable.name: ARRIVEDY
variable.description: F136 Days from enrollment to hospital admission
variable.comment: 0b. Days from enrollment to hospital admission

variable.name: DSCHDY
variable.description: F136 Days from enrollment to hospital discharge
variable.comment: 0c. Days from enrollment to hospital discharge (for nonfatal case) or death

variable.name: ADMDIAGCODE
variable.comment: 0d. What was the primary admitting diagnosis code?

variable.name: DISCHDIAG
variable.comment: 0e. What was the primary discharge diagnosis code?

variable.name: DISCHDISP
variable.comment: 0f. What was the disposition of the patient on discharge?

variable.name: SHORTBRTHONSET
variable.description: F136 Shortness of breath at event onset
variable.comment: 1a. Shortness of breath at event onset

variable.name: NOCTDYSPNEAONSET
variable.description: F136 Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea at event onset
variable.comment: 1c. Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea at event onset

variable.name: DRNOTES
variable.comment: 2. Was there evidence in the doctor's notes that the reason for this hospitalization was heart failure?

variable.name: SIGNSADM
variable.comment: 3a. Signs/symptoms present at the time of admission to the hospital?

variable.name: SIGNSDY
variable.description: F136 Days from enrollment to signs/symptoms known
variable.comment: 4. Days from enrollment to signs/symptoms known

variable.name: WEEKSPRIOR
variable.comment: 4a. If exact date of signs/symtoms unknown, estimate weeks prior to this hospitalization

variable.name: PRIORDIAG
variable.description: F136 Prior diagnosis of heart failure

variable.name: CARDIMAG
variable.comment: 7. Was cardiac imaging performed prior to this hospitalization?

variable.name: EJECTFRACYR
variable.description: F136 years from enrollment to lowest ejection fraction year

variable.name: ALCOHOLHX
variable.description: F136 History of excess alcohol use

variable.name: ILLICITDRUGHX
variable.description: F136 History of illicit drug use

variable.name: TISSUEDISHX
variable.description: F136 History of connective tissue disease

variable.name: LUNGOTHHX
variable.description: F136 History of other chronic lung disease
variable.comment: 9c. History of other chronic lung disease

variable.name: HEARTBLOCKHX
variable.description: F136 History of heart block or other severe bradycardia
variable.comment: 10b2. History of heart block or other severe bradycardia

variable.name: VENFIBHX
variable.description: F136 History of ventricular fibrillation or tachycardia
variable.comment: 10b3. History of ventricular fibrillation or tachycardia

variable.name: CHDYRHX
variable.description: F136 History of CHD within 1 year
variable.comment: 10d. History of Coronary heart disease (within 1 year)

variable.name: PVDHX
variable.description: F136 History of peripheral vascular disease

variable.name: VALVHDHX
variable.description: F136 History of valvular heart disease

variable.name: PRECIPMI
variable.description: F136 Angina or MI precipating factor
variable.comment: 14. Was angina or myocardial infarction listed as a precipitating factor (i.e. precipitated the onset of this event)?

variable.name: SYST
variable.description: F136 Systolic blood pressure at onset, mm/Hg
variable.comment: 15a. Blood pressure at onset or hospital admission: systolic, mm/Hg

variable.name: DIAS
variable.description: F136 Diastolic blood pressure at onset, mm/Hg
variable.comment: 15b. Blood pressure at onset or hospital admission:diastolic, mm/Hg

variable.name: HEARTRATE
variable.description: F136 Heart rate at onset, bpm
variable.comment: 16a. Heart rate at onset or hospital admission, bpm

variable.name: WEIGHTADM
variable.comment: 18a. Weight at onset or hospital admission, kg

variable.name: WEIGHTDSCH
variable.comment: 18b. Weight at hospital discharge or last recorded, kg

variable.name: LOWEXEDEMA
variable.comment: 19a. Lower extremity edema during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: JVD
variable.comment: 19b. Jugular venous distension (JVD) during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: HEPREFLUX
variable.comment: 19c. Hepatojugular reflux during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: HEPATOMEGALY
variable.comment: 19d. Hepatomegaly during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: LEGFATIGUE
variable.comment: 19e. Leg fatigue on walking during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: COUGH
variable.comment: 20a. Cough during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: DYSPNEAREST
variable.comment: 20b. Dyspnea (Rest) (If yes, enter yes for 20c, 20d, 20e, 20f.) during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: DYSPNEAWLK
variable.comment: 20c. Dyspnea (while walking) during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: DYSPNEACLIMB
variable.comment: 20d. Dyspnea (Climbing or exertion) during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: BREATHWLK
variable.description: F136 Stops for breath when walking
variable.comment: 20e. Stops for breath when walking during hospitalization or at admission

variable.name: BREATH100

variable.name: WHEEZING

variable.comment: 21a. S3 gallop during hospitalization or at admission

variable.comment: 21b. S4 gallop during hospitalization or at admission

variable.comment: 21c. Murmur during hospitalization or at admission

variable.comment: 22. Was a chest X-ray performed during this hospitalization?

variable.name: CARDRATIO
variable.comment: 23g. Cardiothoracic ratio greater than or equal to 0.5
